alert.note: Alert for Bailey (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 25 at 12:09AM CDT until May 30 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Texas, including the following county, Bailey. * WHEN...Until 200 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1208 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. An estimated 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen over portions of southern Bailey County with rain rates of 4-5 inches per hour. - Heavy rain can be expected within the next hour with additional thunderstorm activity moving into southern Bailey County. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Maple, Enochs and Muleshoe Wildlife Refuge. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
